file_content.text: It's over... it's finally over.
You won't take me alive!
Ungh... I... this is it, isn't it? This is all I have to show, for everything I've done. Everything I tried to achieve....
There's nothing left, Tavus--just give it up.
It's over.
Keep him in your sights.
Hold it right there.
Go ahead, Tavus. Give me an excuse to put you down for good.
Yes, sir, Lieutenant.
Yes, sir!
Make one wrong move, and you're dead.
Hold it right there.
Dead... they're really dead.
Got any last words, Commander?
Time to finish you off.
I... you... what have I done? They're dead. They agreed with me... they followed me. They died because of me.
Drop the weapon, and we can talk about it.
Just take it easy.
You should've known this would happen, Tavus.
You're surprised?
We... we were the best in the Republic. We never imagined.
Everyone who followed you died for it.
Their deaths are your fault.
And for what? We accomplished nothing. Nothing.
Don't... don't kill me, Lieutenant. I... I can help you.
I--I've learned things. Intel... about the Empire. Bring me in--take me to Garza. Let me... let me undo some of the damage.
Surrender, and I'll take you to General Garza.
Very well.
Are you kidding? You're going to let him live, after everything he's done?
How many people have been killed because of this man? Good Republic soldiers? He deserves to die!
Tavus's knowledge of the Empire could save a lot of lives.
We need his intel.
I can't let your grudge from Ord Mantell ruin the chance for good intelligence, Jorgan.
Drop the personal vendetta.
Fine--let him live. Do what's useful, instead of what's right.
I've changed my mind. Let's make this traitor pay.
You're right, Jorgan.
I've waited a long time for this, Tavus.
You won't take me down without a fight!
You... you've made the right choice. You'll see. Garza will reward you well for... for bringing me in.
I'm going to bring you in alive, and you're going to be court-martialed.
You're going to stand trial.
Trial? What's the point? Traitors are executed. You might as well just... just shoot me now.
You have to face the consequences of your actions.
Choices have consequences.
No... it's better to die here. To die on my feet--to die fighting!
This ends here, Lieutenant! This ends now!
A trial would give you the chance to reveal the truth about what happened to Havoc Squad.
Tell your side.
Yes... yes. I could tell our story. Havoc's story. Finally reveal the truth of the Senate's betrayal.
I... I'll do it. I don't care what happens to me. If the truth is told, then the others won't have all died in vain.
I... I hereby formally surrender, without condition, to the custody of the Army of the Galactic Republic.
You should've done this a long time ago, Tavus.
I accept your surrender.
I... yes. Yes, I see that now.
Don't think for a second that I'll forget what you did.
You're still a traitor to me.
No, I... I wouldn't expect you to.
I'll stay where you can see me, Lieutenant.
On your feet, prisoner!
Let's move, scum.
I... yes. Yes, sir.
No... the truth would never leave the courtroom. Everything will be covered up--Garza will see to it.
Consider this your informal execution.
You want to die now? Fine.
No mercy for traitors.
No. You die here. [Kill Tavus]
Argh!
Die!
Lieutenant. It seems that no matter how hard I try, I can't have any kind of gathering without you.
I guess I shouldn't be surprised. You were a member of Havoc, just like the rest of us. I suppose you belong here, in some twisted way.
It's over, Tavus--surrender.
Give up.
I think we're past that, Lieutenant. Don't you?
You've got nothing to do with Havoc Squad, Tavus. You're a traitor.
You aren't in Havoc anymore.
I am Havoc Squad, Lieutenant. Kardan, me, Wraith, Gearbox, Needles and Fuse--we were Havoc Squad. You are nothing.
I didn't come here to chat.
Yes, Lieutenant, I had pieced that much together for myself.
You should be thanking me, really. I imagine that killing all my comrades... my closest friends, has been good for your career.
I didn't enjoy killing them.
I just carry out my orders.
Do you think that matters? You killed my friends. That's all there is to this.
Kardan and Fuse surrendered. They're alive and well.
They aren't all dead.
Kardan? And Fuse? Hm. That--that's good.
Fuse is still alive--he surrendered.
They aren't all dead.
Fuse... I'm glad he's alright.
Kardan is still alive--he came in willingly.
They aren't all dead.
Kardan? Really? That's... that's good to hear.
But that hardly makes up for the rest, Lieutenant. Nothing can absolve what you've done.
Your people gave me no choice.
There was no alternative.
You always have a choice, Lieutenant. You just never make the right one.
What can I say? I love what I do.
Killing them was a pleasure.
Of course you do.
In the end, I'm glad you've come. I'm glad you intercepted the signal, and glad you've butchered the last of my loyal soldiers.
I'm glad you're here, Lieutenant. I'm glad I get to kill you myself.
It doesn't have to end like this.
It's not too late.
It can only end like this.
Prepare to be disappointed.
You're going to die, just like the rest of your squad.
Enjoy your last moments.
Try me.
It's time, Lieutenant. Let's finish this.
For freedom!
Havoc Squad--battle formation!
Bring it on.
This is for Ord Mantell, Tavus!
Yes, sir!
Face justice, traitor!
Let's see what you're made of, Tavus.
Bring it on.
I've been waiting for this since Ord Mantell.
Time to pay, traitor.
Come on, then!
I've been waiting for you.
You aren't the one I'm waiting for.
No. You die here. [Kill Tavus.]
